column5: BURLINGAME  Calif.  Oct 30 Sprint Corp  promised to gradually offer wireless data speeds far in excess of those offered by bigger rivals like Verizon  as it hopes to use recently acquired wireless airwaves to regain market share.

column4: Intel looking to exit TV project  in talks with Verizon
column5: Chipmaker Intel Corp is having second thoughts about getting into the television business and is in talks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over its Internet TV initiative  a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column5: Oct 30 Chipmaker Intel Corp is having second thoughts about its nascent television service and is in talks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over the business  according to a report on tech website All Things D  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Visa profit falls as U.S. consumer spending weakens
column5: Visa Inc   the world's largest credit and debit card company  reported a 28 percent fall in quarterly profit due to a higher income tax provision and was slightly pessimistic about its outlook in the face of soft U.S. consumer spending.

column4: UPDATE 2-Visa profit falls as U.S. consumer spending weakens
column5: * Says 2014 expectations slightly lower than they were in July

column4: Visa profit falls 28 pct due to higher tax provision
column5: Oct 30 Visa Inc  the world's largest credit card company  reported a 28 percent fall in quarterly profit due to higher income tax provision.

column4: Western Union's shares tumble as outlook disappoints
column5: Shares of Western Union Co  fell as much as 19 percent on Wednesday  after the money transfer company said it did not expect earnings growth in 2014 due to higher compliance costs.
